title: Omnibus Report on Significant Trade Deficits

enrichment.summary: This executive order requires the Secretary of Commerce and the U.S. Trade Representative to prepare a comprehensive report identifying major trade deficits the United States had with foreign countries in 2016. The report will analyze causes of these deficits, including unfair trade practices, and assess their impacts on U.S. manufacturing, employment, and national security.
potential_concerns: Efforts to address trade deficits through enforcement actions may lead to retaliatory tariffs harming manufacturing workers and union members reliant on export markets.

Focusing on defense-industrial-base strengthening might prioritize certain industries at the expense of broader manufacturing sectors, potentially affecting working-age adults employed outside defense-related fields.
Increased scrutiny and potential sanctions against trading partners for unfair practices could disrupt supply chains, causing job insecurity among manufacturing and defense industry workers.

Worker-rights-protections emphasis may lead to stricter trade barriers that, while aiming to protect U.S. jobs, could increase costs for consumers and harm overall employment growth among working-age adults.
